APStats.question: What is the equation for a z-score?
APStats.solution: The z-score will always be equal to the observed value (x) minus the mean (μ) over the standard deviation (σ). This is because the z-score is a score that represents where a datapoint rests on a normal distribution curve.

APStats.question: How does a positive outlier affect a dataset?
APStats.answer: The median stays relatively the same, and the mean increases
APStats.solution: When adding a positive outlier, the value will shift slightly for the mean. This is because the mean is the average of a data set, and adding a higher value will shift the mean to include this higher value, causing the mean to increase. In comparison, the median only takes the number of each value into account, so the middle value does not change very much.
choices: The median decreases, the mean stays relatively the same.
The median stays relatively the same, and the mean increases.
The mean and median stay the same.

APStats.question: Bias in sampling method is
APStats.answer: Any difference between the sample results and the truth about the population that tends to occur in the same direction whenever using this sampling method
APStats.solution: During sampling, bias is created when results are skewed unevenly towards a specific population.
choices: Any difference between the sample result and the truth about the population.
The difference between the sample result and the truth about the population due to using chance to select a sample.
Any difference between the sample results and the truth about the population due to practical difficulties such as contacting the subjects selected.
Any difference between the sample results and the truth about the population that tends to occur in the same direction whenever using this sampling method.

APStats.question: The head of the admissions office at a small college wants to understand why minority students who visit her school do not eventually enroll. The college holds a preview weekend for students who have been admitted. Two months later, after the students have decided which college to attend, a survey is sent out to all minority students who attended the weekend visit but who did not choose to attend this college. About a third of them returned the survey, with 48% of those indicating that they received a larger scholarship offer elsewhere. Which is true?
APStats.solution: As there was only around a third of the participants who responded to the survey, there is a large amount of the population that is unaccounted for. This is known non-response bias, which can skew the results of a survey because the opinions of the rest of the population is not known.

APStats.question: 20 men and 20 women with migraine headaches were subjects in an experiment to determine the effectiveness of a new pain medication. 10 of the 20 men and 10 of the 20 women were chosen at random to receive the new drug. The remaining 10 men and 10 women received a placebo. The decrease in pain was measured for each subject. The design of this experiment is…?
APStats.solution: The subjects (men and women) are organized into different groups within their groups, which makes them blocked by gender. The participants are randomized, which makes it a randomized block.
choices: Completely randomized with one factor, gender
Completely randomized with one factor, drug
Randomized block, blocked by drug and gender

APStats.question: The average yearly snowfall in Mars is normally distributed with a mean of 55 inches. If the snowfall in Mars exceeds 60 inches in 15% of the years, what is the standard  deviation?
choices: The standard deviation cannot be computed from the given information

APStats.question: For events A and B related to the same chance process, which of the following statements is true?
APStats.answer: If A and B are independent, then they cannot be mutually exclusive
APStats.solution: Independent events are events that can occur at the same time, but do not affect the outcome of each other. In comparison, mutually exclusive events are events that cannot occur simultaneously. Because of this, an event cannot be independent and mutually exclusive at the same time.
choices: If A and B are mutually exclusive, then they must be independent
If A and B are independent, then they must be mutually exclusive
If A and B are not mutually exclusive, then they must be independent
If A and B are independent, then they cannot be mutually exclusive

APStats.question: 17 people have been exposed to a particular disease. Each one independently has a 40% chance of contracting the disease. A hospital has the capacity to handle 10 cases of the disease. What is the probability that the hospital’s capacity will be exceeded?
Which of the following random variables is geometric?
APStats.answer: The number of digits I read in a randomly selected row of the random digits table until I find a 7
APStats.solution: For a geometric variable, an instance is repeated until it occurs. In this instance, the action (reading numbers) is repeated until the goal is reached (finding a 7) which makes it geometric.
choices: The number of times I have to roll a die to get two 6s
The number of cards I deal from a well-shuffled deck of 52 cards until I get a heart
The number of digits I read in a randomly selected row of the random digits table until I find a 7
The number of 7s in a row of 40 random digits

APStats.question: Suppose a student is randomly selected from your school. Which of the following pairs of random variables are most likely to be independent?
APStats.answer: X = average amount of homework student does per night; Y = student’s height
APStats.solution: In statistics, the definition of independence is ‘two events that can occur at the same time, but do not affect each other/the probability of the other event occurring.’ Logically, a student’s height and the amount of homework a student has are two variables that can occur at the same time, but do not affect each other.
choices: X = student’s height; Y = student’s weight
X = student’s PSAT Math score; Y = PSAT Verbal score
X = average amount of homework student does per night; Y = student’s GPA
X = average amount of homework student does per night; Y = student’s height

APCalc.question: There is a sphere that is growing at a rate of 4 m^3/s, please find the rate at which the radius is changing.  area of a sphere= 4πr^2
How do you find a local maximum with the first derivative?
APCalc.answer: Look for when the derivative goes from positive to negative
APCalc.solution: Local maxima are found when the first derivative is equal to zero, and it changes signs
choices: Look for when the derivative goes from positive to negative
Looking for when the derivative goes from decreasing to increasing
Look for a when the derivative goes from increasing to decreasing
Look for when the derivative is goes from negative to positive

APCalc.question: If you were given a function f(x), and were told to find the rate of the rate of it, what would you do to it?
APCalc.answer: Find the second derivative of f(x)
choices: Rate it twice on yelp, subsequently
Find the second derivative of f(x)
Give it to high schoolers to judge, and then have other high schoolers judge those high schooler, like judgey high schoolers
Find the first derivative of f(x)

Physics.question: Young's modulus is the property of?
Physics.solution: young's modulus is only applicable to solids because of the deformation, ductility, stretching and resistance of the object.

Physics.question: An artificial Satellite revolves round the Earth in circular orbit, which quantity remains constant?
Physics.solution: When in orbit, velocity, and other accelerations change, but angular acceleration is always the same

Physics.question: Which one of the following has the highest value of specific heat ?
With the increase of pressure, the boiling point of any substance:
Physics.solution: The boiling point is proportional to the air pressure. The higher the air pressure, the higher the boiling point.
